author: matthiasksieber
title: Developer Ecosystem
description: どうすれば、開発者が成功するアプリの開発に集中できるような、ポジティブな開発者体験を作ることができるでしょうか？

f6_assessments.q0: In spite of the Community and IOG's strategic efforts to convert Cardano into an open-source project, I believe that we should, as a community, provide space for the teams that wish to maintain their project as a closed-source project, as there are countless examples of projects of this type that continue to provide value.
f6_assessments.q1: Compared to fund 7, the amount requested has been reduced from 2,000,000 to 1,000,000. The last time have this challenge was in fund 6, where 102 proposals were submitted, 54 were approved by the community, and 20 were ultimately funded. I agree that the community has the capacity to address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: For a challenge like this that has been addressed in several Catalyst cycles, it would be great if you could share the status of the proposed metrics from the past cycles as a supporting argument. Having reviewed the suggested success metrics, I must say that some of them are quite vague and difficult to measure. I believe they should be reviewed before the next fund is launched.

f6_assessments.q0: The note explaining the difference between this challenge and the Open Source Development Ecosystem is an excellent addition and while the latter is more closely aligned on the mission to turn Cardano into an open source project, this challenge does meet the mission criteria to accelerate the growth and evolution of the developer and application ecosystem and prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Individually, the budget of each of the Developer challenges is within the Community's capacity, based upon previous funding rounds, however the combined $2.2 million budget is a bit of a stretch but with the increased total budget to $12.8 million the community may desire to fund both options. To improve challenge: better articulate the demonstrated demand for the proposed budget (most easily done based upon excess total proposal budgets in previous funding rounds).
f6_assessments.q2: Some of the key metrics are not really measurable like "Filling in gaps defined in the exploration stage" and "A sense of community and conversations" but otherwise the success criteria and metrics are fine. To improve challenge: better articulate how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0:
The developer ecosystem whether open source or not is paramount to any computer based technology. It's what makes thing possible in the first place. The richer with solutions this ecosystem is the more projects and opportunities will exist in Cardano.
This challenge is therefore essential to our community. As a developer myself with more than 20 years of experience I can attest that the developer ecosystem of any language or technology is what will make the difference when choosing a framework or language over another to build something.
This challenge (previously also including open source and closed source solutions) has been there since the very first Catalyst fund and has been the most successful with many funded projects and also many projects being voted but not funded due to the sheer number of proposals being submitted within the challenge each fund. The more tooling we have the more likely things will get done in our Cardano ecosystem instead of somewhere else.

This is the non-open source version of the challenge. Although it may seem that the open source version would be preferable over the closed source one, and that one should vote for it and not the other, this is a mistake in my opinion: many of the previously funded proposals in the previous funds were closed source and yet allowed many projects to be built upon them. A good example would be the BlockFrost APIs which, while being partially closed source, allowed others to use them freely for their own projects, open source or not. So we actually need both to be successful!
In my opinion both this challenge and its open source version are the most important challenges of every funds.
f6_assessments.q1: As demonstrated in the 6 previous funds, there is no doubt that our community has the resources to address this challenge given the hundreds or projects already funded in previous funds and all the projects that missed being funded due to exhaustion of funds...
f6_assessments.q2: In this closed source version, we won't be able to check the quality of the source code being created but we will still be able to see easily if other projects are using the provided solutions or not as a direct indicator of usefulness and quality. Moreover great tooling can be judged without seeing the source code (UI, IDE, or any other facilitating solution)

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge is a consequent continuation and aligns very well with Cardanos mission. It can also be said to have a societal impact, as providing a good developers ecosystem can empower a lot of people and help them establish new skills that will bring them further.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge has well-reflected metrics that enable a wide variety of solutions while still providing the neccessary constraints. The challenge team is well-known, competent and credible. The challenge is reasonable to expect solutions in a timely manner. The repeated continuation of the challenge however also enables long-term projects, which is great.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics are well-set and enable producing very auditable proposals.

importance: 開発者の意欲を高める素晴らしい体験を提供することで、開発者の採用率、生産性、創造性の向上につながります。
success: カルダノには活発な開発エコシステムがあり、開発者は自分が提供するサービスを収益化することでビジネスを拡大することができます。
